intro: Alectra vogelii, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable for several years, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed areas. Alectra vogelii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
